intro: Astragalus kharvanensis, commonly known as the Kharvan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, harsh environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seed pods contain small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind.
